required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of TA-650 in Pediatric Patients With Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety, and Pharmacokinetics of TA-650 in Pediatric Patients With Moderate to Severe Ulcerative Colitis.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the the efficacy of TA-650 using Clinical activity index (CAI) score and other evaluation indicators in pediatric patients with moderate to severe ulcerative colitis after TA-650 administration of at a dose of 5 mg/kg at weeks 0, 2, and 6, and then every 8 weeks at weeks 14 and 22. The safety and pharmacokinetics are also evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of Patients Who Achieved CAI Remission
primary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 2, 6, 8, 10, 14, 18, 22, 26, 30, and the last time point during the period from administration of the study drug to Week 30
primary_outcome.description: Clinical activity index (CAI) remission was defined as a case where a CAI score was not more than 4 on the evaluation day. CAI score was an activity index to evaluate disease activity, which is calculated as the sum (0 to 29 points) of subscores for 7 clinical conditions, consisting of the number of stools per week, blood in stools (based on weekly average), investigator's global assessment of the symptomatic state, abdominal pain/cramps, temperature elevation due to ulcerative colitis, extraintestinal manifestations, and laboratory findings (hemoglobin or ESR). A higher score indicates greater disease activity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,Weeks 2, 6, 8, 10, 14, 18, 22, 26, 30, and the last time point during the period from administration of the study drug to Week 30
secondary_outcome.description: CAI score was an activity index to evaluate disease activity, which is calculated as the sum (0 to 29 points) of subscores for 7 clinical conditions, consisting of the number of stools per week, blood in stools (based on weekly average), investigator's global assessment of the symptomatic state, abdominal pain/cramps, temperature elevation due to ulcerative colitis, extraintestinal manifestations, and laboratory findings (hemoglobin or ESR). A higher score indicates greater disease activity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,Weeks 2, 6, 8, 10, 14, 18, 22, 26, 30, and the last time point during the period from administration of the study drug to Week 30
secondary_outcome.description: Mayo score consists of four subscores (stool frequency, rectal bleeding, physician's global assessment and findings of endoscopy), each of which was assessed according to a four-level rating scale (0 to 3 points), and was determined from a total of the four subscores (0 to 12 points). In addition, the sum of the subscores (0 to 9 points) for stool frequency, rectal bleeding and physician's global assessment was used as a partial Mayo score. A higher score indicates greater disease activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pediatric Ulcerative Colitis Activity Index (PUCAI) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline,Weeks 2, 6, 8, 10, 14, 18, 22, 26, 30, and the last time point during the period from administration of the study drug to Week 30
secondary_outcome.description: PUCAI score was determined as a total of the subscores for each of the six evaluation items (0 to 85), including abdominal pain, rectal bleeding, stool consistency of most stools, number of stools per 24 hours, nocturnal stools and activity level. A higher score indicates greater disease activity.

intervention.description: TA-650 will be intravenously infused at 5 mg/kg as an induction regimen at Weeks 0, 2, 6. For subjects who meet the responder criteria, TA-650 will be administered at 8-week intervals thereafter until week 22.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have been diagnosed as ulcerative colitis at least 3 months prior to screening.
- Have active ulcerative colitis despite adequate conventional therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have severe pancolitis.
- Patients who have undergone surgery for ulcerative colitis within 8 weeks before enrollment or who were judged to require surgery for ulcerative colitis at enrollment.
- Patients who have a history of treatment with infliximab or other biologic products (anti-TNFÎ± agents, anti-IL-6 agents, etc.).

results_reference.citation: Tajiri H, Arai K, Kagimoto S, Kunisaki R, Hida N, Sato N, Yamada H, Nagano M, Susuta Y, Ozaki K, Kondo K, Hibi T. Infliximab for pediatric patients with ulcerative colitis: a phase 3, open-label, uncontrolled, multicenter trial in Japan. BMC Pediatr. 2019 Oct 13;19(1):351. doi: 10.1186/s12887-019-1739-5.

group.title: TA-650
group.description: Patients received TA-650 5 mg/kg at Weeks 0, 2, and 6; patients with a decreased CAI score at Week 8 were considered to be responders and received further doses at Week 14 and 22. Non-responders (patients with unchanged/increased CAI score) at Week 8 did not receive further study treatment. Assessments were conducted until Week 30 in responders and until Week 14 in non-responders.

group.title: TA-650
group.description: TA-650 is administered at a dose of 5 mg/kg at Weeks 0, 2 and 6, followed by administration at 8-week intervals at Weeks 14 and 22, based on the evaluation index such as CAI score.

outcome.title: Percent of Patients Who Achieved CAI Remission
outcome.description: Clinical activity index (CAI) remission was defined as a case where a CAI score was not more than 4 on the evaluation day. CAI score was an activity index to evaluate disease activity, which is calculated as the sum (0 to 29 points) of subscores for 7 clinical conditions, consisting of the number of stools per week, blood in stools (based on weekly average), investigator's global assessment of the symptomatic state, abdominal pain/cramps, temperature elevation due to ulcerative colitis, extraintestinal manifestations, and laboratory findings (hemoglobin or ESR). A higher score indicates greater disease activity.
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 2, 6, 8, 10, 14, 18, 22, 26, 30, and the last time point during the period from administration of the study drug to Week 30
outcome.population: Five patients were discontinued. The reasons for discontinuation were adverse event in 1 patient, lack of efficacy in 2 patients, and worsening ulcerative colitis in 2 patients. Two non-responders were observed, and both of them completed the efficacy evaluation at Week 8.

group.title: TA-650
group.description: TA-650 is administered at a dose of 5 mg/kg at Weeks 0, 2 and 6, followed by administration at 8-week intervals at Weeks 14 and 22, based on the evaluation index such as CAI score.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
